concept-wr.title: Secure HTTPS External Connectivity
concept-wr.shortdesc: Titanium Server provides support for secure HTTPS external connections for REST API access and Web server access.

section.title: Enabling HTTPS Access (optional)
section.p: To enable secure HTTPS access for REST API applications and the Web server, a digital certificate is required during software installation. When secure HTTPS connectivity is chosen, HTTP is disabled.

For evaluation purposes, you have the option to select a self-signed certificate included with Titanium Server. For actual deployment, Wind River strongly recommends that you use a CA-signed certificate. You must obtain the certificate and copy it to the controller host before starting the controller configuration script. You can update the certificate at any time after installation.

note.p: CGTS-5418If the self-signed certificate is in use, remote clients must be configured to accept the certificate without verifying it ("insecure" mode) in order to connect.

section.title: Installing a digital certificate
section.p: To install a CA-signed digital certificate, follow the procedure for installing and configuring the Titanium Server system. During this procedure, you must copy the certificate PEM file to the controller host before running the controller configuration script.

section.title: Updating a digital certificate
